isis.stitle: New Vehicle Processing Manual - CF 500, CF 600 Heat Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC) System - SERVICE PROCEDURES - DRAINING AND FILLING THE COMPRESSOR OIL

svcproc.title: DRAINING AND FILLING THE COMPRESSOR OIL
svcproc.para: The amount of oil contained in the compressor can only be determined by removing the compressor from the vehicle and draining the oil into a calibrated container.

note.para: After draining the oil from the compressor, approximately 60 ml (2.0 fl oz) of oil will remain in the compressor.

step1.para: Verify that the system is discharged.

Drain compressor oil from the suction and discharge ports, into a calibrated container, while turning the shaft (clockwise only) 8 to 10 full rotations by hand or with a socket wrench on the armature retaining nut. If the compressor is to be reused, place protective caps on the suction and discharge ports.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Drain Oil While Turning Shaft (Clockwise Only)

step1.para: Measure and record the amount of oil drained from the compressor.
Inspect the oil for signs of contamination such as discoloration or foreign material.

caution.para: When oil is added directly to the compressor, insure that it is added only to the SUCTION port. The SUCTION port is larger in diameter than the DISCHARGE port.

note.para: Refer to OIL FILL GUIDELINES for the correct quantity of new oil to put into the compressor.
In the following step, it may be helpful to rotate the compressor shaft slowly (clockwise only) to distribute the oil being added.

step1.para: Add the required amount of new oil directly to the SUCTION port of the compressor.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Add New Oil to the Suction Port

step1.para: Place protective caps on the suction and discharge ports until the compressor is ready to be installed.
